newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil frees 1.04 mln tns export sugar tax-free.
newsitem.headline: Brazil frees 1.04 mln tns export sugar tax-free.

text.p: Brazil's government authorized an additional 1.04 million tonnes of sugar to be sold exempt of export tax, a government sugar official said.
"It has been published in the government's official gazette today," the official from the Industry and Commerce Ministry's sugar and alcohol department said.
Of the total, 735,600 tonnes can be exported from the center-south region and 304,400 tonnes from the north/northeast region, the official said.
In the official crop plan published in June, the government allowed for some 5.2 million tonnes of sugar to be exported.
But until today only 80 percent of this total had been authorized for sale exempt from export tax as the government wanted an opportunity to monitor the harvest and in particular alcohol supply.
Center-south producers where the harvest began in mid-April have recently been pushing the government to release exemptions for their remaining quota so that they can make fresh sales.
